intro: Bidens micrantha var. kaalana, commonly known as the smallflower tickseed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, narrow leaves and produces small, yellow flowers with two lobes. Its seeds are easily dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and fields.
